{"step_by_step_thinking": "Korff fibers, also known as von Korff fibers, are mentioned in several documents. According to Document [2], they are thick collagenous fibers in the developing tooth that begin in the dental papilla, spiral between the cells of the odontoblast layer, and form the matrix of the dentin. They are often the first sign of dentin formation. Document [0] and Document [4] also mention that these fibers contribute to the formation of mantle dentine. Therefore, the answer should be 'Mantle dentin'.", "answer_choice": "A"}
